creator: eharrow@mcrl.com
text:
Checked log4j out of cvs and tried to build log4jMini but it fails to compile as
there are references to a RootLogger.java that does not even exist in the
repository.

Created attachment 11901
Updated build with correct jar name
creator: eharrow@mcrl.com
ralph.curtis@symbium.com
text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> Created an attachment (id=11905) [edit]
> New RootLogger.java

Log4jMini still doesn't build when checked out of CVS due to this bug. After 
applying the changes from this bug's attachments, I am able to build. Is there 
any reason why the changes are not checked in? Is this even the right place to 
be asking these questions?

creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
log4jMini moved from log4j tree into the sandbox.  Checkout using

svn co http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/sandbox/log4j/log4jMini/trunk log4jMini

All attachments applied which resulted in a successful build, but no other correctness or other review 
done.

creator: ralph.curtis@gabrielsoftware.com
text:
Created attachment 17154
patch for 1_3alpha6

Changes I have made:
- Fixed project so that it builds. The latest version in cvs would not build.
This obsoletes patches contributed earlier for this bug.
- Refactored Category and related category oriented classes to Logger and
related logger oriented classes for compatibility with main log4j project.
- Added pattern types %d, %D for specifying date and time. Similar but not the
same as log4j.
- Added a ConsoleAppender for further compatibility with main log4j project.
- Fixed examples so that they work with changes.
- Corrected javadoc problems where found.
- Cleaned up the build script. Builds as version 1_3alpha_7
